name: Void Runner (Millimedia Games)
description:
BEFORE YOU PLAY:

This game was made in 2 days (about 7 hours), because I happened to be going on a family holiday the same week as the jam. That didn't stop me from participating though.

My jam goals were to focus on lighting effects to make the game look decent, and only use the default Unity sprites. It was a lot harder than I expected.

------------------------------

Void Runner is a game about a strange creature, sacrificing it's life for numbers...

Play through a minute long level, with a choice:

  • Play through the entire thing on 1 health, for maximum points
  • Play it safe, and just try to get through the level, not focusing on points.

The theme of the jam is 'Less is More'. Less health is more points.

Comment your high score in the description below, I'd love to see it! (My high score is 188)

Scoring system:

  • 100 points for loosing a life
  • 6 points per second when on 2 hp
  • 60 points per second when on 1 hp
  • When you finish the game, your score is divided by the time you spent. Your final score is displayed below the 'You Win!' text.

Controls:

  • This game uses standard platformer controls:
  • Space/W to jump (A on gamepad)
  • A to move left (left joystick on gamepad)
  • D to move right (left joystick on gamepad)
  • Jump again while in mid air to double jump
  • (It should support gamepads, but I'm not sure. I can say my gamepad works but no idea if others will.

Credit

Everything in this game was made by me (not including the unity default sprites, they were made by the unity team)

Music was made in LMMS (https://lmms.io/), feel free to download the music and use it for anything, just credit me.

Cover was made with Corel Painter Essentials 7 and my drawing tablet (Intous small)

Made with Unity, Free version
